speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, David M. Weisharr, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure  * * *  ## Transcript {nick hartley}    _Act One.  Scene One - Radio Station. Frasier is nearing the end of his show when he gets another caller._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, who's our last caller?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Roz
text: On line two we have Marilyn.  She's feeling a little homesick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Marilyn.

speaker: Marilyn
text: [_v.o:_] Well, I like living in Seattle but, I don't know, I grew up in this little town in Wisconsin and I really miss that life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're not the only one.  My producer Roz has regaled me with many stories of the great Dairy State.

speaker: Marilyn
text: You're from Wisconsin, Roz?  What part?

speaker: Roz
text: Bloomer.

speaker: Marilyn
text: Oh my God, I'm from Monomeney.

speaker: Roz
text: No way!  You're from Menomonie?  My cousins are from Menomonie, do you know the Rayburns?  _By this time Frasier is getting a bit irritated, however he plays along._

speaker: Marilyn
text: [_v.o:_] Billy Rayburn is your cousin?  I used to work with him at Bell's Frozen Custard!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_bored:_] Of course she did.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you remember that guy that used the run the store, with all the moles?

speaker: Marilyn
text: [_with Roz_] Mr. Sneedy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ladies, as fascinating as this is, I'm afraid we're out of time.

speaker: Marilyn
text: [_with Roz:_] Oh!

speaker: Roz
text: That's okay, Marilyn, you can call back tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Make sure you all tune in tomorrow for Part 2 in our series, "Women of the Cheese Belt."  Goodbye for now, and good mental health.

speaker: Roz
text: These messages came for you earlier, your wines are ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excellent.  I'm hosting a tasting tonight for the wine club Niles and I belong to.  I'm hoping they name me the Maitre d'Chai.  It's a long-standing dream of mine to wear that silver cup around my neck.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, back in Wisconsin if a guy wore a cup around his neck it meant he'd ticked off the gym teacher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!  Make sport, but this does happen to be important to me.

speaker: Roz
text: Since when?  You used to say that club was nothing but a bunch of arrogant cork-sniffing snobs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was before I got in.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, when I'm handing out baloney sandwiches this weekend at the homeless shelter, it will do me heart good to know that a bunch of wealthy men are swishing two-hundred-dollar bottles of wine and spitting it into silver buckets!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_upset:_] It's not like we don't recycle the bottles. **SIP, SWISH, SPIT**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. That evening Niles and Frasier are practising for their wine tasting evening.  Frasier is wearing his blindfold as he smells and sips a wine.  Niles holds a silver bucket. Frasier eventually spits it out, however he misses and Niles is forced to wipe it up with his tissue._

speaker: Frasier
text: Big, full-bodied, nicely baked.  Essence of truffles, long finish - Chambertin 76'.

speaker: Niles
text: Bravo, Frasier.  If only your aim were as accurate.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_who is cleaning up:_] How is it those same taste buds can't tell the difference between my pot roast and my flank steak?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, considering you learned to cook in England, it's a wonder I can't tell your flank steak from a braised tennis ball.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, let's move on to the number seven.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smells another glass:_] Ah, touch of oak.  Hint of currant. Whisper of....

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smelling:_] ...what is that, what is that?  Oh yes, wet dog! [_takes blindfold off and looks at Martin_]

speaker: Martin
text: You guys still playing that stupid game?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, wine tasting is not a stupid game - it's a highly refined skill.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I just saw a couple of guys on the corner practising out of paper bags.

speaker: Niles
text: We're hardly winos.  Some very distinguished people belong to our club: the mayor, the commissioner of public safety, the chief of surgery at St. Lukes...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just the people I want walking around all liquored up. Could you find room for a school bus driver and a couple of air traffic controllers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we would if they had impeccable taste.  Which reminds me dad, I have a favour to beg.  Would you mind if I moved your chair into your room until after the tasting?

speaker: Martin
text: Forget it, you might as well ask me to stay in my room.

speaker: Niles
text: Which takes care of the second favour.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, move it.  At least I don't have to spend the night watching your society pals getting tanked.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Niles, grab an end.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs, then:_] Oh, you're serious.  You know I don't lift.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, with that stick where it is I'm surprised you can bend. Start hoisting, come on.  _Niles does this and the two, with much effort and much ad-libbing, manage to carry it upstage.  Of course Frasier is holding his end up higher than Niles's.  Frasier remarks it weighs a ton.  It is not long before Niles wants to put it down.  However, Frasier tells him not to.  Yet after much quarrelling he drops it right on the upstage flooring._

speaker: Frasier
text: Look what you've done!

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried:_] You better be talking about the floor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course I'm talking about the floor...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for Pete's sake, it's just a little scratch.  Get me a yellow magic marker.  I'll color it in, no one'll know the difference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you have no idea how critical these people can be: they love finding fault.

speaker: Daphne
text: We could put a rug over it.

speaker: Frasier
text: A rug?  Where a rug doesn't belong?  Why don't you just throw down a Twister mat, have a few rounds between vintages?!

speaker: Niles
text: Steady Frasier, there's still hope.  I'll bring my contractor by in the morning.  The man's a genius.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, it's time you guys learned, everything doesn't have to be perfect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's that kind of advice that leads to shag carpeting!  _Frasier holds his head in his hands as we FADE OUT.  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. The next morning Frasier and Martin are at the table reading the paper. They have both just got up.  Daphne enters from her bedroom in a robe._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good morning Daphne - extra pancakes for me this morning!  I'm famished!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, well you should have thought about that last night before you started making cracks about English cooking. I have hung up my spatula. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you moved my chair, you cut off my pancake supply; why don't you just back out over Eddie on your way to work and make it a hat trick? [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And a hat trick would be?

speaker: Martin
text: It's in hockey where one player...

speaker: Frasier
text: Enough said, thank you.  _Frasier goes to answer the door.  Niles is standing there with a seemingly strong and good-looking man._

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning, Frasier.  I'm delivering one miracle worker as promised.  Joe DeCarlo, Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pleasure.

speaker: Niles
text: And my father, Martin Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Joe.

speaker: Joe
text: Where's the scratch?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you mean you didn't see it?  We were going to put some orange cones around it so nobody would fall in it!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's right here.

speaker: Joe
text: I can get rid of that.

speaker: Frasier
text: It has to be done by five.  My guests arrive at seven, so it has to be a firm five.  Not a five-fifteen or a five-thirty.

speaker: Joe
text: I'll be done by noon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Splendid.

speaker: Niles
text: I told you he was good.  We're talking about a man who has satisfied Maris.  Something that's still regrettably on my to-do list!

speaker: Daphne
text: Coffee's ready. [_enters with coffee, to Frasier:_] Of course, I'm sure it'll taste like my old bath water to you.  You know, how it gets all grey and scummy around the edges with little flecks of... [_notices Joe:_] oh, hello.

speaker: Joe
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_notices him properly; saucily:_] Hello.  _Daphne and Joe stare each other with longing as Niles tries to stop it._

speaker: Niles
text: I'd love some coffee, Daphne. [_pause_] Hmm, Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: Er, Daph', this is Joe DeCarlo.  Joe, this is Daphne - she helps me out around here.

speaker: Joe
text: Smells great.  Columbian?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs:_] No, English. [_realises:_] The coffee - Costa Rican. Would you like a cup?

speaker: Joe
text: Thanks.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll be right back. [_whispers to Martin:_] He's adorable, talk me up.

speaker: Martin
text: A plate of pancakes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Deal. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: You know, Joe, Daphne's a great gal.  You know, she doesn't always go round in that ratty old bathrobe.  She cleans up real cute.

speaker: Joe
text: You don't have to convince me.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I think dad's right - you don't need to fix that scratch, it adds character. [_takes him aside:_] Come, Joe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, forget it!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters from kitchen:_] Honeybun?

speaker: Joe
text: [_as if it was a pet name:_] Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Hee hee, I meant would you like one of these with your coffee? [_holds up a honeybun_]

speaker: Joe
text: Oh, I'd love one.

speaker: Daphne
text: Anything...?

speaker: Joe
text: No. [_then:_] Sugar?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_as if it was a pet name:_] Yes.

speaker: Joe
text: I meant in the coffee.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Maris is quite keen on gutting my library to make more space for her hats.  Why don't you come home with me and you can send one of your men over to do this little job. Bruce would be good - the large sweaty gentleman with the chili dogs on his breath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Joe is here already and we do have a deadline.

speaker: Niles
text: But, don't you think it would be prudent...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it's settled.

speaker: Joe
text: That's great, because I'm kinda anxious to get at her. [_goes upstage_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_angry:_] I'll just bet he is, the testosterone is just dripping...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, he's talking about the scratch.

speaker: Niles
text: [_angry still:_] I knew that!  Only I know that!  I mean, watch him!  _Niles exits out the front door as we FADE OUT.  Scene Four - Elevator In Frasier's Building. Later that day Frasier is going up in the elevator with two workmen. He is curious and so begins to chat._

speaker: Frasier
text: Someone remodelling?

speaker: Electrician
text: No, bad wiring in one of the condos.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well I hope you won't be here this evening.  I'm entertaining some very important guests and you know how sound travels in this building.

speaker: Painter
text: Ah, can't make any promises.  We're here as long as this poor sap is willing to pay us. [_laughs_]  _RESET TO: Hallway Outside Frasier's Apartment. They both get off on the same floor.  Frasier goes to put his key in the lock and notices the electrician and painter are standing behind him ready to enter his apartment.  RESET TO: Frasier's Apartment. Frasier enters his apartment to find sawing and drilling around his fireplace.  There are a few cloth sheets on the floor and a hole in the wall._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is happening?

speaker: Joe
text: Hold on, guys. [_they all stop:_] Er, sorry about this, Dr. Crane, but I plugged in the sander to start on the floor, you blew a circuit.

speaker: Frasier
text: So naturally you're sawing a hole into my wall.

speaker: Joe
text: The circuit blew - it started a fire.  You've got some real bad wiring in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: But how long? [_they start again_]

speaker: Joe
text: A couple of hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: "A couple" is vague.  That would mean the big hand would be on the twelve and the little hand would be...?

speaker: Joe
text: On the four.

speaker: Frasier
text: On the four?  Oh, the four is okay, fine.

speaker: Martin
text: You know the fire, Eddie smelled it first. [_exits to room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well he's a regular canary in a coal mine, isn't he!

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters from front door with a case:_] My God, what's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't ask, Niles. [_notices case:_] Oh, I see you've got the Romani Containe.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but unfortunately they only had the one bottle.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's funny, the importer told me he had two.

speaker: Niles
text: Really? [_nervous:_] How strange.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if I didn't know you better I would swear you had squirreled one away for yourself.  But then we both know that you must be telling the truth, because you're such a slave to your ethics that even the slightest transgression would cause your nose to bleed.

speaker: Niles
text: Which it isn't! [_sniffs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You just sniffed.

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't sniff, it was a snort of contempt. [_sniffs again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: A snort is out, that was in.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes a tissue and holds it to his nose:_] Oh, alright - the other bottle's in the car in my bowling bag.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_curious:_] You have a bowling bag?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Maris and I have taken to giving each other gag gifts. I gave her a cook book.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yoohoo.  I noticed how your shirt was [_knees turning to jelly:_] clinging to your back and... I thought a nice cup of iced tea might hit the spot.

speaker: Joe
text: Thanks, Daph'.  _Joe takes the drink from him.  At that moment they both shudder. Daphne laughs._

speaker: Daphne
text: Ho-ho, I got a spark.

speaker: Joe
text: Me, too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_jealous:_] That's just static electricity from the carpet - it can happen to anyone.  I'll show you. _Niles shuffles backwards along the carpet, then shuffles forward and pokes Frasier in the stomach, without result.  He shuffles further back, then shuffles forward and pokes Frasier again, without result. Digging his heels in hard, he shuffles back even further, then shuffles forward and-_

speaker: Frasier
text: STOP POKING ME!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_picking up bags:_] Should I put these little fingery foods for tonight in the fridge?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes please - the Brie is sweating up a storm.

speaker: Joe
text: Let me help you with those.

speaker: Niles
text: No Daphne, let me help you.  _Daphne picks them up and begins to hand a drink to Bruce.  However, Niles takes the drink and gives it to Bruce.  He feels a spark._

speaker: Niles
text: Spark!  Spark!  _Niles follows Daphne into the kitchen as Frasier announces to his workmen:_

speaker: Frasier
text: I will be back after work at five-thirty - I hope I have your word that my apartment will be perfect for then.

speaker: Joe
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, think think before you answer.  This is not like marriage vows, or a promise to a dying parent.  This really, really counts.

speaker: Joe
text: You have my word.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Bruce
text: God, I'm sweating like a pig.  I've got to air myself out. [_to Frasier:_] Hey, hold the elevator, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I need this nose tonight, thank you.  _Frasier exits out the front door.  Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne are busy in the kitchen putting the foods away._

speaker: Niles
text: You don't have to keep feeding these men.  Actually, Maris finds they work faster if you keep them hungry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hee hee, I don't mind.  Of course, I probably don't cook as well as their wives or girlfriends.  That is, if they all have girlfriends.  I'm sure Joe's probably mentioned some girl to you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_honestly:_] No.

speaker: Daphne
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: [_worried:_] That is... not any one girl.  Not old "love'em and leave'em" Joe.  From what I've heard, he's wrecked more homes than he's fixed.  Mimsie Stanshope has him over all the time, and I don't just mean to strip her entryway.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_disappointed_] Oh, I see.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it's better I should know now before I get my hopes up. Thank you for being honest with me.  _Daphne exits as Niles pulls out of the fridge.  He stands for ages against the fridge holding a tissue to his nose to stop it bleeding.  End Of Act One. (Time: 12:20)  Act Two._  **THE CLOT THICKENS**  _Scene One - Hallway Outside Frasier's Apartment. It's half past five when Frasier gets off the lift and realises there is no sound.  It is as if all the workers have gone home.  However, just as he puts the key in the door he hears all the commotion.  Frasier enters his apartment only to hit the door on his mantle piece, which has been taken off the fireplace and stuck near the door.  Now, all the furniture has been either covered by dust sheets or moved to other corners of the room.  There is a vast amount of dust soaring through the apartment and there is a scaffolding around the fire on which a man stands.  Also, even more people are scurrying around in the room including Joe and Bruce.  Martin and Eddie are sat at the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_conspicuous:_] Joe...

speaker: Joe
text: Dr. Crane, don't panic, I can explain everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wonderful.  Perhaps you can explain [_points to man on scaffolding:_] these legs.

speaker: Joe
text: That's Cecil.  He's the best ceiling guy in Seattle.  We were lucky to get him.  When we opened up the wall to get to the faulty wiring, we found that the gas pipes leading to your fireplace were cracked.  Had to be fixed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: I OK'd it.  It just seemed wiser to do it before the explosion.  _Martin gives a smug smile as Niles tries to enter.  However, he bangs against the mantlepiece._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, the club members arrive in forty-five minutes. Have you lost your... [_notices legs and waves upwards:_] Cecil!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't yell at me.  If you were able to lift anything heavier than an emory board we wouldn't be in this position.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe next time you'll listen to your old man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, dad.  You know, I was just considering whether I should go shave or slit my wrists.  You made my choice a little easier.

speaker: Joe
text: Don't worry, we are gonna make it.  Only... about that shaving.  We had to shut the water off to replace a valve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that explosion idea's sounding better and better. [_phone rings:_] Could someone at least move that mantle piece away from the door! [_answers phone:_] Hello? [_can't hear him:_] Just hold on, will you?  _Frasier moves over to upstage to take the call as Martin talks to Joe._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Joe, you know you're going to be through by seven?  It gives you plenty of time for [_points at Daphne who has now entered:_] a dinner and a movie.  _Joe goes over to ask Daphne out.  However, the noise is so intense neither we or Daphne can hear him.  Daphne keeps asking what he said and she eventually lip-reads his question.  She answers, however now he nor we can hear her.  Joe asks everyone to quiet down and all of a sudden the following erupts:_

speaker: Daphne
text: I said I don't want to go out with you!

speaker: Joe
text: [_embarrassed, turns to colleagues:_] Whatcha looking at?  Get back to work! [_to Martin:_] Thanks a lot!

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns to Niles:_] Why would she do that?  She's crazy about him!  _Niles however is stood looking up at the ceiling.  You can tell that he is trying to hold the blood in his nose.  Martin realises this._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, is your nose bleeding?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I was just admiring Cecil's handiwork.  _Niles exits to the powder room as Frasier puts the phone back on the recieving and tells Martin who it was._

speaker: Frasier
text: That was the mayor on the phone.  Apparently his wife can't make it tonight so he has invited [_mad:_] Senator Adler!  Can anything else possibly go wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: Take a look at that. [_points to floor_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God.  Is that blood on my floor? [_walks along a trail:_] And another drop.  _He crosses to the powder room and opens the door.  We see Niles sitting on the toilet holding a tissue back on his nose._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  _RESET TO: Powder Room The scene continues as Frasier enters the powder room and closes the door behind him.  Along with Martin, Frasier now realizes the cause of Daphne's behavior, and is clearly intolerant of any excuses Niles plans to make._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Niles
text: Is it terribly wrong to mislead someone even if it is for his or her own good?

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you tell Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: I made up a story that Joe seduces all the women he works for so she wouldn't go out with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry, yet calm:_] Oh Niles, how could you be so selfish?

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't do it for me, I did it for her.  She deserves a doctor, or a lawyer - someone for whom a T-shirt is an undergarment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I don't know what sort of twisted fantasy you've concocted about you and Daphne.  I suppose it involves a comet hitting the earth and you and she having to rebuild the species!  But trust me, Niles, it is not going to happen. She needs a man - one who can do more for her than just smell her hair.  [_N.B. This speech was originally written by Joe Keenan for Scene Two of [2.3], "The Matchmaker," but was used here instead._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opens door and calls:_] Daphne!

speaker: Niles
text: What are you going to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: You are going to fix this.

speaker: Niles
text: What am I going to tell her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell her the truth.  Only the truth shall make you clot.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters:_] Yes, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes Daphne, er, Niles has something he wishes to discuss with you.

speaker: Daphne
text: What is it, Dr. Crane? [_points at tie:_] Oh look, you have a spot on your tie. _Niles explains to Daphne whilst she mops up the blood that has fallen to his tie._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, earlier, what I said about Joe - I made a mistake.  He doesn't sleep around, he hasn't wrecked any homes, and the business about Mimsie Stanshope...

speaker: Bruce
text: [_enters:_] Oh sorry, is there a john around here to air out my paddle?

speaker: Niles
text: You can use the master bedroom. [_to Daphne:_] Joe never worked for Mimsie Stanshoe..

speaker: Bruce
text: He sure didn't.  I do all the work at Mimsie's.  She is one tough lady to satisfy.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's you?

speaker: Bruce
text: I'm the only guy that can make her happy, everyone knows that.  Jeez. [_exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_realising:_] So, that was the mistake you heard.  Those stories you heard weren't about Joe, they were about Bruce?

speaker: Niles
text: Hard to believe, isn't it?  But you know, when society women go slumming they go all the way!  So, you can tell Joe that you've changed your mind about going out with him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh no, I couldn't.  What would I say?

speaker: Niles
text: Just tell him the truth.  Tell him that I heard stories that he... [_nose starts bleeding:_] No, bad idea!  Here.  You... [_cleans toilet seat with tissue:_] wait here.  _Daphne sits down as Niles exits.  Outside, Niles walks over to Joe calling him._

speaker: Niles
text: Joe.

speaker: Joe
text: Yep?

speaker: Niles
text: [_goes over to him_] You have to ask Daphne out again.

speaker: Joe
text: Are you nuts?  You heard what she said.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but if you ask her again; she'll say yes.

speaker: Joe
text: Hey, maybe I've changed my mind.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, you haven't changed your mind.  You're just letting masculine vanity and hurt feelings keep you from something that other men can only dream of in their oxblood seated leather wingback chair with the lights off.

speaker: Joe
text: Look, Dr. Crane, I just don't think it'll work out - okay?

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not okay.  If you had ever... smelt her hair, you'd know she's worth at least one more try.  She is an angel, and she is a goddess - and she's waiting for you in the bathroom. _Joe thinks about it, then chucks Niles on the elbow and knocks on the powder room door._

speaker: Joe
text: You got a minute?  _Niles watches as Daphne and Joe disappear to the bathroom.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Later that evening, everything is still as it was.  Frasier enters from the bathroom with bits of blood-stuck tissue paper on his face from where he cut himself shaving.  He goes over to the table where Martin and Niles are sitting.  The phone sounds._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm never going to make it.  Daphne, would you please get that? [_she does_]

speaker: Martin
text: Jeez, I thought you were just going to slit your wrists. It looks like you went for "death of a thousand cuts."

speaker: Frasier
text: I cut myself because I was shaving without water.  And why was there no water?  Because I had to move your chair, which gouged the floor, which made me call for Joe, who found bad pipes, who called for Cecil, who ate the cat that killed the rat that lived in the house that Frasier built!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier, re: phone call_] That was the doorman.  Senator Adler's limousine just pulled up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's over, it's over.  Sing, fat lady, sing.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, what are we going to do?

speaker: Martin
text: Will you give me your cash?  Both of you, come on!  Hurry up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Never mind why, just hand it to me.  Come on, be quick, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes money out of wallet:_] Oh all right, do you want all seven hundred dollars?

speaker: Martin
text: You carry seven hundred dollars in your wallet?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Maris asked me to stop by the drugstore later.

speaker: Martin
text: Just hand it over. [_shouts to workmen:_]  Okay, guys.  I've got seven hundred and some odd dollars here.  If you can get everything cleared up before Frasier's buddies get here it's yours to split any way you want on your way out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bribery?  That's your big plan?  _However, it does actually work as the workmen suddenly move with lightning speed and impeccable precision; furniture is replaced, the scaffolding is removed, and dust sheets are zapped away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, it's starting to work!  Hey, here's another hundred I was holding out on my old man!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey! [_takes it_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Daphne
text: Joe told me what you did.  I think that's the nicest thing anyone's ever done for me.  Thank you. [_kisses Niles on cheek and jumps back_] Oh!

speaker: Niles
text: Did you feel that?  We made a spark.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, we did.  I guess you were right, it is just the carpet!

speaker: Joe
text: [_shouting:_] Okay everybody, come on.  Move it, move it, move it.  We're out of here.  _Joe picks up the seven hundred dollars as everyone except Frasier, Niles, Martin, Daphne and Joe hurry out.  The room is restored as Joe asks Daphne:_

speaker: Joe
text: Are you ready?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to rest:_] Good night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight Daphne, have a good time. _Joe and Daphne exit.  The room is now in perfection and is seamlessly rid of workmen and any sign of them.  Frasier is ecstatic._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, we did it, we actually did it. [_Martin begins to exit_] Oh dad, please don't leave, I'd like you to stay.  I mean, you helped me to get this put together tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, thanks Fras'.  That makes me feel good.  Not good enough to hang around that bleeding-heart-softie-on-crime Senator Adler, but good. [_calls:_] Come on Eddie, the politicians are coming!  _Martin exits to his room as Eddie quickly follows him.  The doorbell goes and the brothers are excited.  Frasier answers the door.  The camera goes to a P.O.V from the guests who receive Frasier's welcome:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Senator Adler, Mayor - welcome to my humble abode.  _Bruce appears behind Frasier, pulling up the crotch of his pants and holding up a bare cardboard roll._

speaker: Bruce
text: You know you're out of T.P. in the can?  _Frasier smiles at his guests covering up for Bruce as we FADE OUT.  End Of Act Two. (Time: 21:00)_
